comment: Chin was great up until the project rolled around. Hw was okay, easy but long(ish). Labs were basically a free 100. No midterm. Project kicked everyones butts big time. only gave us 2 weeks which was not enough at ALL. He did grade them very lightly. Final was paper pencil with coding (heinous) but it was an easy A if you did your work.

Dr. Chin is a good professor for embedded systems. This class is hard and you need to know C++ to do well. The midterm and final exam were very hard, so if you want an A in this class, study extremely hard. The project is also difficult, but you get lots of time at the end of the semester to finish it. Don't wait to start on it. (Old Embedded)

He was very friendly and very caring. He gave us a little extra credit and was very generous when grading tests. There was a lot of work when you combined the lab and the lecture but overall the workload was not even that bed. You only had to do four out of the eight  home-work assignments of your choice.

Professor Chin is a great guy by all means, but is not the best lecturer. When I took his class I felt like I knew the bare minimum, which made his tests nearly impossible. He will show you how to do the easy problems, but the hw and tests have only the most difficult problems. If you are willing to teach yourself you can take him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He clearly knows his stuff and is good at teaching it. He welcomes questions and his answers are helpful. Pretty easy class if you attend the lectures and look at the test objectives he posts.

Overall, Professor Chin does a good job of explaining concepts in lecture, and he works out problems in class to further your understanding. Don't just read the PowerPoints, do the homework and practice the worked examples. Graded by 4 tests for 40%, 11 labs for 25%, HW, Quizzes, and Group for 10%, and a final for 25%. I'd recommend him for 2301.
Professor Chin did a great job at explaining Embedded systems despite the shorter timeframe for the summer semester. Lectures are based on PowerPoint slides but he explains them very well.

He is an amazing teacher. Lectures did not help me much but I went because he does remember your name. His test are doable , he gives you a cheat sheet- front and back. Really no reason to fail his class. Everything is straight forward. He is a slightly hard grader but he gives you a grade guideline on what he is looking for on everything.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took for ethics and I enjoyed the class, show up to class and you will be fine. Chin is very nice and tries to help whenever possible.

Nice, knowledgeable guy. But the class is big and the lectures consist of going over powerpoints and doing examples. I didn't get much out of that but the homework he assigns is very efficient at getting you to learn the concepts (if you don't cheat on it). Also his tests are easy.

tests are to long so most of the class doesn't finish, but he gives partial credit and you can make your own cheat sheet, as soon as you get the test PUT EVERY FORMULA RELEVANT TO THE PROBLEM DOWN it was the only way i past his exams with a B. also go to lab is weights more then the final, there are pop group projects, anything turned in late 0

For an intro class this is great. Really easy and basic concepts covered, the assignments to be completed have clear grading criteria and instructions. He does expect you to take notes on the concepts, but that's it. He is all about real world applications and only going over what's actually useful and if it will matter in industry.

He obviously found this class to be a joke, and it honestly was. If you just show up you'll pass, because attendance is mandatory. Also, make sure you take notes on every lecture, because he checks notes.

Class is Boring since he just sits and talks but he puts all the lecture notes on D2L. Then lets you use them for the test. I went to only 2 lectures and made a B in the class because the Internet wasn't working so I couldn't access the notes. Make sure to study some before the test just incase

This rating is for a foundation class, and he teaches more advances classes that may give an alternative view. EE1000 is a very basic, and somewhat boring class, and this clearly rubs off on the instructor. Lectures consisted of mainly him just reading off slides, but attendance is mandatory (more than 6 absences results in failing the class).

One of the better professors that I have had.  Easy going, tests are relatively easy and will work with you if you have work related issues. Homework assignments are very easy as they can be answered through lectures. Open books/notes tests. I would recommend this professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: 4 test +final. test are hard. hw problems are graded for completion. Tough grader but gives good feedback. If you review the hw problems (he post solution to hw problems), the test shouldn't be too bad. Gives graded work back in timely manner. approachable with questions. Very organized!  Makes you work for your grade but I would take him again!
Nice Guy and pretty lenient. Tough Grader tho

Majority of the lecture slides were disregarded in class but were not removed from the D2L lecture presentations causing confusion as to what the student should emphasize while prepping for exams.  The exam questions were always more challenging than homework or example questions from lecture.
Professor Chin can't teach if his life depended on it, but he is a nice guy and willing to help as much as he can. In the two classes I took with him, I got 2 Bs without understanding the material.
Great professor, uses power points very frequently, quizzed and test come from optional homework and group assignments
Nice guy.
Nice guy
Only read power points, of which were also posted on schools site. Bad explanations of theories, principles, and application.
